description.narrative: Myanmar Digital Rights Forum 2020 is a two day conference planned for February 2020. The purpose is to take stock of the progress (or regression) achieved in 2019 with regard to strengthened digital rights in Myanmar and support the joint identification of priorities and opportunities for engagement 2020.

Myanmar Forum för Digitala Rättigheter 2020 är en två-dagars konferens som planeras till februari 2020. Syftet är att utvärdera framgångar (eller bakslag) under 2019 i arbetet för att stärka digitala rättigheter i Myanmar samt stödja gemensam identifiering av prioriteringar och möjligheter för engagemang inom digitala rättigheter 2020.

Myanmar Digital Rights Forum 2020 will build on the previous three MDRFs and serve several key purposes: Connect: Meet and take stock of the progress (or regressions) achieved in 2019 Learn: Raise awareness among the key stakeholders and decision makers by highlighting the impact of the ongoing Digital Rights movement and current issues, including through production of a short Myanmar Digital Rights Status Report to the 2020 Forum rounding up developments in 2019 Collaborate: Bring together key stakeholders and decision makers - government, journalists, activists, technologists, policy advocates, digital safety trainers, and the private sector - to collectively build new ideas for reforming policies, services, strategies and tools Plan: Support and collectively work on the joint identification of priorities and opportunities for engagement on future digital rights activities, especially in Myanmar's election year - 2020.

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
5.b - Enhance the use of enabling technology, in particular information and communications technology, to promote the empowerment of women.
5.b - Öka användningen av gynnsam teknik, i synnerhet informations- och kommunikationsteknik, för att främja kvinnors egenmakt

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The purpose of the MDRF 2020 was to evaluate progress (or regression) in the work for strengthened digital rights in Myanmar and support the joint identification of priorities and opportunities for engagement in 2020. The number of participants were expanded this year to more than 400 key stakeholders from civil society, activists, lawyers, media, private sector and government. 43 % of the participants were women and 33 % of the speakers were women. The situation regarding digital rights was discussed and priorities for 2020 in the areas of Freedom of expression, Right to Privacy, Equality of Access and Elections were concluded.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
